alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 3:29PM CDT until May 16 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Forks ND has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Minnesota... South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. .Ongoing rises on the south branch of the Buffalo River are expected to allow the river to cross into minor flood stage. Additional rainfall is expected over the next 48 hours and may contribute to further rises. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, MINOR FLOOD STAGE. Flooding on road cut at old meander scar east of gage begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 13.5 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
